Package Pacman

Class Canvas

  • java.lang.Object
    • Pacman.Canvas
  • public class Canvas
extends java.lang.Object
    Canvas is a class to allow for simple graphical drawing on a canvas.
    Author:
    Pascale Launay, Nicolas FONNIER, Henri GLEVEAU

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      static java.awt.Color BACKGROUND
      The canvas initial background color
      static int HEIGHT
      The canvas initial height
      static int WIDTH
      The canvas initial width

      Modifier and Type Method Description

      Draw a given image onto the canvas.

      Draw a given text onto the canvas.
      void erase​(java.lang.Object referenceObject)
      Erase a given shape's from the screen.

      • close

        public void close()
        Destroys the main JFrame component and closes the window

      • wait

        public void wait​(int milliseconds)
        Wait for a specified number of milliseconds before finishing. This provides an easy way to specify a small delay which can be used when producing animations.
        Parameters:
        milliseconds - the delay to wait for in milliseconds

      • draw

        public void draw​(java.awt.image.BufferedImage image,
                 int x,
                 int y)
        Draw a given image onto the canvas.
        Parameters:
        image - the image to draw
        x - the x location of the image
        y - the y location of the image

      • drawString

        public void drawString​(java.lang.Object referenceObject,
                       java.awt.Color color,
                       java.lang.String text,
                       int x,
                       int y)
        Draw a given text onto the canvas.
        Parameters:
        referenceObject - an object to define identity for this shape
        color - the color of the text
        text - the text
        x - the x location of the text
        y - the y location of the text

      • erase

        public void erase​(java.lang.Object referenceObject)
        Erase a given shape's from the screen.
        Parameters:
        referenceObject - the shape object to be erased
